title: Slide effect on VueJS
description: Use An Easy and Flexible Transition To Make A Slide Effect On Vue

children.value: provide some default classes to apply
styles on any of these transition phases, every
represents a phase to show the elements:
Here a little snippet that you can use on in order to make a slide from left or right

Then on the styles tag of the component or in a dedicated stylesheet,
optionally you can change the

props.code:
<style>
.show-enter-active,
.show-leave-enter {
    transform: translateX(0);
    transition: all .3s linear;
}
.show-enter,
.show-leave-to {
    transform: translateX(100%);
}
</style>

title: Vue Event Modifiers Examples
description: Catch when user press enter with Vue modifiers

children.value: directives to get an event and display something:

props.code:
<script setup>
    const message = ref('');
    
    const showMessage = function () {
        console.log(message);
    }
</script>

<template>
    <input v-model="message">
    <button type="submit" @click="showMessage">click me</button>
</template>

children.value: How to fire a method with press-key event?
Well, there is another modifier for this behavior, lets supposed that we need to tight a press-enter event and fire

props.code:
<script setup>
    const message = ref('');

    const showMessage = function () {
        console.log(message);
    }
</script>

<template>
    <input v-model="message" @keyup.enter="showMessage">
    <button type="submit" @click="showMessage">click me</button>
</template>

children.value: When user press enter and key up event is fired, it would catch the event and execute the method

,
well this would be ok in many scenarios like a search-box
For regular forms the event submit and it's modifiers like

props.code:
<script setup>
    const message = ref('');

    const showMessage = function () {
    console.log(message);
}
</script>

<template>
    <form @submit.prevent="showMessage">
        <input v-model="message">
        <button type="submit">click me</button>
    </form>
</template>

links.text: How to fire a method with press-key event?
